bibl.title: Οἶνος. Production and Import of Wine in Graeco-Roman Egypt

series.title: The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements

bibl.note: Doctoral diss., Univ. of Warsaw, 2011. - Introduction. - Sources. - Part One. Local wine production in Egypt: 1. Wine producing regions; - 2. Vineyard owners; - 3. Persons engaged in wine production; - 4. Kinds of wine produced in Egypt; - 5. Sale and distribution of wine. - Part Two. Import of wine to Egypt: 6. Aegean Sea; - 7. Western Asia Minor; - 8. Southern Asia Minor (Pamphylia and Cilicia); - 9. Ionian Sea; - 10. Crete and Onysia; - 11. Cyprus; - 12. Italy and Sicily; -13. Gaul; - 14. Spain; - 15. Levant. - Conclusions: Continuity, change, and diversity in Egyptian wine production; - Patterns in the import of wine. - Bibliography. Indices.
bibl.seg: Dorota Dzierzbicka, Οἶνος. Production and Import of Wine in Graeco-Roman Egypt = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume XXXI.
Warsaw, University of Warsaw - The Raphael Taubenschlag Foundation, 2018, xx-527 pp., figg. ISBN 978-83-946848-1-5. €59.

Doctoral diss., Univ. of Warsaw, 2011. - Introduction. - Sources. - Part One. Local wine production in Egypt: 1. Wine producing regions; - 2. Vineyard owners; - 3. C.R. par Peter van Minnen, BASP 57 (2020) pp. 427-432. - Garance Clapuyt, ChrEg 95 (2020) No. 190, pp. 337-339.
